info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 16 at 8:38PM CDT until June 18 at 2:18AM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri...
Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County.
For the Marmaton River...including Fort Scott, Nevada...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Marmaton River near Nevada.
* WHEN...Until late Tuesday night.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, minor flooding occurs near the gage site and affects low lying areas along the river.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Monday the stage was 20.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM CDT Monday was 20.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.5 feet on 05/13/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Tuesday evening at 845 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY NIGHT
